result.execSummary:
The defendant John James Barrett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Lewd, Lascivious Behavior-Exposure, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John James Barrett in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk: LMS.  DOC agent, Mindy Sabljak present in court.  
Court previously deferred the issue of expungment.  DOC oppose expungment.  State takes no position.  Court hears arguments from defense.  Court DENIES the request for expungment.
PROBATION STATUS REVIEW, received and filed. lms
Certification of transcript of proceedings of SENTENCING HEARING commencing 11-09-2015 received and filed. (16 Pages.)

Defendant John James Barrett in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Parties held discussions in chambers with the court.  Court orders a copy of the sentencing transcript.  Defendant appears to be in compliance.  Review hearing scheduled for July 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
PROBATION STATUS REVIEW, received and filed. lms

Defendant John James Barrett in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for sentencing hearing.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent with case #15CM2620, with credit for 0 days time served.  Huber privileges for work and treatment.  No electronic monitoring.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 YEAR.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Continue current treatment.
* Sex offender assessment by an outside agency and follow through with recommended programming.
* No contact with Lindsay W. or Stephanie C.	
* Maintain employment.
* Defendant is not to go to any children's departments or children's stores.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges or a CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered, including tax intercept.  Cash bail to apply.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

Court withholds ruling on defendant's motion for expungement pending a review hearing.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing on 4/11/16 at 8:30 am in Branch 6.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Received and filed, from Mastantuono & Coffee.  lms

Defendant John James Barrett in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Court has no objection to a consolidation of the Waukesha case.  Court ordered case adjourned to allow the state to comply with victim notification.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant John James Barrett in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.
Parties just finalized negotiations and stipulate to an adjournment.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant John James Barrett in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant John James Barrett in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 6.
All parties are notified that effective August  3, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Ellen Brostrom, Branch 6,  in Room 423 of the Safety Building.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 06-25-2015 at 08:30 am.

Prior: 3616 18th Avenue, South Milwaukee, WI 53172
Oral No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with any Walmart store

Defendant John James Barrett in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Lovell Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 10.vb
